description: Coined in the 20th century from contra- +â€Ž conceptive; compare the related contraception.

adjectives.description: contraceptive (comparative more contraceptive, superlative most contraceptive)

entries.meaning: That acts to prevent conception as a result of sexual intercourse.
examples: She was careful to take her contraceptive pill at the same time every day.

entries.meaning: A mechanism or means by which conception as a result of sexual intercourse can be prevented or made less likely.
examples: Putting a pig's bladder over one's penis before intercourse is not a good contraceptive.
